title: RAG Web Browser
description: RAG Web Browser for a retrieval augmented generation workflows. Retrieve and return website content from the top Google Search Results Pages

query.title: Search term(s)
query.description: Use regular search words or enter Google Search URLs. You can also apply [advanced Google search techniques](https://blog.apify.com/how-to-scrape-google-like-a-pro/), such as AI site:twitter.com or javascript OR python

maxResults.title: Number of top search results to return from Google. Only organic results are returned and counted
maxResults.description: The number of top organic search results to return and scrape text from

outputFormats.title: Output formats
outputFormats.description: Select the desired output formats for the retrieved content

requestTimeoutSecs.title: Request timeout in seconds
requestTimeoutSecs.description: The maximum time (in seconds) allowed for request. If the request exceeds this time, it will be marked as failed and only already finished results will be returned

proxyGroupSearch.title: Search Proxy Group
proxyGroupSearch.description: Select the proxy group for loading search results

maxRequestRetriesSearch.title: Maximum number of retries for Google search request on network / server errors
maxRequestRetriesSearch.description: The maximum number of times the Google search crawler will retry the request on network, proxy or server errors. If the (n+1)-th request still fails, the crawler will mark this request as failed.

proxyConfiguration.title: Crawler: Proxy configuration
proxyConfiguration.description: Enables loading the websites from IP addresses in specific geographies and to circumvent blocking.

initialConcurrency.title: Initial concurrency
initialConcurrency.description: Initial number of Playwright browsers running in parallel. The system scales this value based on CPU and memory usage.

minConcurrency.title: Minimal concurrency
minConcurrency.description: Minimum number of Playwright browsers running in parallel. Useful for defining a base level of parallelism.

maxConcurrency.title: Maximal concurrency
maxConcurrency.description: Maximum number of browsers or clients running in parallel to avoid overloading target websites.

maxRequestRetries.title: Maximum number of retries for Playwright content crawler
maxRequestRetries.description: Maximum number of retry attempts on network, proxy, or server errors. If the (n+1)-th request fails, it will be marked as failed.

requestTimeoutContentCrawlSecs.title: Request timeout for content crawling
requestTimeoutContentCrawlSecs.description:
Timeout (in seconds) for making requests for each search result, including fetching and processing its content.

The value must be smaller than the 'Request timeout in seconds' setting.

dynamicContentWaitSecs.title: Wait for dynamic content (seconds)
dynamicContentWaitSecs.description: Maximum time (in seconds) to wait for dynamic content to load. The crawler processes the page once this time elapses or when the network becomes idle.

removeCookieWarnings.title: Remove cookie warnings
removeCookieWarnings.description: If enabled, removes cookie consent dialogs to improve text extraction accuracy. Note that this will impact latency.

debugMode.title: Debug mode (stores debugging information in dataset)
debugMode.description: If enabled, the Actor will store debugging information in the dataset's debug field
